author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 22,159 students will appear for Plus Two exams and 27,948 candidates for the SSLC exams this year in the district, according to Collector T.N. Hariharan.

Addressing a meeting of officials at the Collectorate here on Wednesday, he said that infrastructure and basic amenities would be provided at all examination centres. Uninterrupted power supply would be ensured to all centres. Mobile phones, modern wrist watches and calculators would not be allowed inside halls. Flying squads and special supervisors would be deputed, he added. District Revenue Officer A.M. Nagendran, Chief Educational Officer Subashini and other officials took part.
title: Arrangements for Plus Two, SSLC exams
